body: When Mel Miller was stripped of his Assembly seat after being convicted of fraud charges, Brooklyn lost both its decades-long hold on the Speaker's post and a political leader whose brash personality and political acumen had been the threads holding together the borough's disparate Democratic factions. Now, with important local issues like
title: With Miller Gone, Brooklynites Brawl for Power

body: Assembly Speaker Mel Miller was convicted of fraud charges yesterday, shattering his career as one of the most powerful politicians in New York State. Mr. Miller, of Brooklyn, was convicted of 8 of the 19 felony charges against him. The verdict means that he is automatically expelled from the State Assembly and faces the likelihood of going to
title: Miller Is Found Guilty of Fraud; Speaker Loses Seat in Assembly

body: THE best-looking blue spruce in the United States was grown last year in Connecticut, on Ski's Christmas Tree Farm in Lebanon. A blue ribbon on the wall of the office of the farm's operators, B. John and Mary Skawinski, attests that their tree was judged the top prize winner for spruces by the National Christmas Tree Growers Association at its
title: In Search of the Perfect Christmas Tree

body: An expert who had already won a major title here at the American Contract Bridge League's Fall Nationals was on track to win a second here today. Hugh Ross of Oakland, Calif., who owns three world team titles and won the Life Master Open Pairs on Saturday, was a member of a squad that was leading going into the final two sessions of the Open
title: Bridge

body: Here is a sampling of tours by bus, van, helicopter and foot that are scheduled during the holiday season in New York City. Dates and times are subject to change. Today DEAD HORSE BAY, Floyd Bennett Field, Exit 11S off the Belt Parkway, Flatbush Avenue, Flatlands, Brooklyn. A walking tour led by National Park Service rangers will explore the
title: TOURS

body: Renting a Villa in Greece Q. I am interested in renting a villa in Greece for one or two weeks next summer. Are there any agencies I can contact? -- Geraldine Del Bagno, Staten Island A. The first thing to bear in mind is that villas in Greece tend to be simpler, less luxurious than, say, villas in the south of France. They do not routinely come
title: Q and A

body: The crime was ordinary; the suspect was anything but. A 70-year-old woman was mugged on Friday night by a man who grabbed her pocketbook as she returned to her home in the Bay Ridge section of Brooklyn. The man, the police said yesterday, was a police officer. The officer, James Carey, 36, was arraigned yesterday on charges of second-degree robbery
title: Policeman Charged in Robbery

body: Kimberly Rebecca Parker, a daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Milton Parker of Roslyn, L.I., was married last night to Seth Matthew Ingall, a son of Dr. and Mrs. David Ingall of Highland Park, Ill. Rabbi Jack Bemporad performed the ceremony at Temple Israel in Lawrence, L.I. The couple graduated from American University, where Mr. Ingall is a law student and
title: Kimberly Parker Is Married on L.I.

body: A young man leaving a party in Brooklyn early yesterday was held up by three men, and after turning over the only money he had -- $2 -- he was shot to death, the police said. The victim, Kevin Jones, 20 years old, of 657 East 2lst Street in the Kensington section, was one of a number of people who have been wounded or killed at or near sites of
title: Brooklynite Leaving Party Is Shot to Death in Holdup That Nets $2

body: Budget cuts and the recent days of grueling heat have conspired to make life harder for some of New York City's elderly residents. As part of the city's efforts to cut spending, responsibility for 346 city-financed centers for the elderly has been transferred from the Human Resources Administration to the Department of Aging. That shift, together
title: Cutbacks and Heat Wilting the Elderly

body: WITH a big brood in tow, Phil Skrzyniarz of Cheshire entered Beehive Field in New Britain on a recent balmy evening. His group included five of his six children and two of their friends. They were all in high spirits, eager to watch the New Britain Red Sox play the Reading (Pa.) Phillies in an Eastern League baseball game and equally eager to
title: Fans Call Games a Bargain (Even With Peanuts and Cracker Jack)

body: A rookie police officer was listed in stable condition yesterday after being wounded by a bomb as three men bungled a house robbery in Queens late Wednesday and then terrorized other people as they fled, the police said. Three men were arrested last night and charged with attempted murder of a police officer, criminal possession of a weapon,
title: Officer Injured By Bomb Tossed In Robbery Bid

body: ALTHOUGH people of many ethnic backgrounds live in the 4.2-square-mile Brooklyn neighborhood of Sunset Park, residents and business owners say the community is more a stew pot than a melting pot. "Each ethnic group is proud of its heritage," said Ross M. Branka, a real-estate lawyer who has practiced in the area more than 20 years. "So we have
title: If You're Thinking of Living in: Sunset Park

body: A 17-year-old high school student was arrested Wednesday night in a series of rapes that terrorized the Flatbush section of Brooklyn, the police said yesterday. The suspect, Keith Gordon of 2323 Newkirk Avenue in the Kensington section of Brooklyn, was seized outside a clothing store on Nostrand Avenue by two detectives who were driving one of the
title: 17-Year-Old Seized in Rapes In Flatbush

body: Dr. and Mrs. Milton Parker of Roslyn, L.I., have announced the engagement of their daughter Kimberly Rebecca Parker to Seth Matthew Ingall, a son of Dr. and Mrs. David Ingall of Highland Park, Ill. An August wedding is planned. Miss Parker, 23 years old, and her fiance, 25, graduated from American University, where Mr. Ingall is a law student. She
title: Kimberly Parker to Marry Seth Ingall
